events.message: Customer reported a collision involving their vehicle on April 30th with another car at a busy intersection.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident based on the keywords in the initial report.
An insurance agent was assigned to assist the customer with the vehicle collision claim promptly.
Customer received an acknowledgment confirming that their claim for the car accident was received and is in process.
Customer was asked to submit police reports, photographs of the vehicle damage, and any medical bills related to the collision.
The customer submitted the requested police report, pictures of the damaged vehicle, and repair estimates electronically.
The investigation team began evaluating the circumstances and evidence surrounding the auto collision claim.
Investigation concluded that the customer was not at fault and the damages reported are consistent with the collision.
A settlement offer covering the full repair costs was proposed to the customer based on investigative findings.
Customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed satisfaction with the efficient handling of the claim.
The insurance claim for the auto accident was formally approved following customer agreement on the settlement terms.
Payment was issued to the customerâ€™s repair shop to cover the vehicle damage as per the approved claim settlement.
The insurance claim case was closed after payment confirmation and final review ensuring customer satisfaction.
All claim documents and correspondence related to the auto accident case were archived for future reference.
